attributes.text: This interface defines what an application class has to implement.

Called in the document.beforeunload event of the browser. If the method returns a string value, the user will be asked by the browser, whether he really wants to leave the page. The return string will be displayed in the message box.
Called when the application’s main method was executed to handle “final” tasks like rendering or retrieving data.
Called when the application relevant classes are loaded and ready.
This method contains the last code which is run inside the page and may contain cleanup code.
